::Prowl::

Prowl didn't hear the thought itself, but he felt IR's feelings, stopping in the hallway. He couldn't leave her, something inside him prevented him from doing so. He stops, though he was already around the corner, fighting with his own mind on whether to walk away, stay here, or walk back to IR.







--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> * IR sighs and leans against Prowl, hugging his shoulders.
> She knew that he felt bad.*
> 
> " It's old news, love.  I'm sorry."
> 
> * It was a hope that he would try to forget what mistake he had made, to 
> remember that what was done was done. And it had been for the best all the 
> same.
> She kept forgetting that, and it wasn't right to keep slaming him for it.
> But Iron drew her hand to her chest after Prowl shrugged it off, looking at 
> his back with sad eyes as he walked away from her.
> < Don't leave me.> her mind thought, but it was so quiet it was almost 
> impossable for Prowl to hear.
> Iron tilted her head to the side and leaned a shoulder against the wall.
> < So, Cyndro's just like Iris then.> But her mind kept turning towards 
> Prowl, wishing she could do something to make him feel better.
> Suddenly then, her mind lit up.*
> 
> " Cyndro?"
> 
> * Maybe this computer mastermind could help her in that little problem.*
> 
> 
> 
>
